pwm.weightdynamics

Class ThreeCompartmentModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • pwm.weightdynamics.ThreeCompartmentModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.apache.commons.math3.ode.FirstOrderDifferentialEquations

    public class ThreeCompartmentModel
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.apache.commons.math3.ode.FirstOrderDifferentialEquations
    The three compartment human weight dynamics model developed by NIDDHK.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ThreeCompartmentModel

        public ThreeCompartmentModel(int currentWeight,
                             double height,
                             double age,
                             java.lang.String gender,
                             double pal_init)
        Parameters:
        currentWeight - The Participant current Weight in KG's
        height - The participant current height in meters
        age - The participant current age in years
        gender - Participant Gender (Male / Female )
        pal_init - The participant current exercise activity level ( 1.0 - 3.0 ) 1.0 - No physical activity 2.0 - High Intensity physical activity 3-4 times a week

      • getTimeStep

        public int getTimeStep()
        Returns:
        the time step in days that the model uses to estimate the participant weight after.

      • setTimeStep

        public void setTimeStep(int time)
        Parameters:
        time - set the time in days to estimate the participant weight after

      • setCurrentParameters

        public void setCurrentParameters(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> currentCalories,
                                 java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> pal_final)
        Parameters:
        currentCalories - A list of daily calories that the participant is supposed to eat.
        pal_final - A list of daily physical activity level that the participant should be exercising at.

      • getFinalWeight

        public int getFinalWeight()
        Returns:
        the participant final weight at the end of time_step, as calculated by the model.
